column1: \ This is a template for your own plain-text reading log.
\ This file can be parsed by the Reading gem
column2: so that you can display the data on a webpage.

column1: \ The examples below are taken from the CSV format guide:
\ Any line in this file starting with a backslash (\) is a comment and will be ignored by the Reading parser.
\ Feel free to delete these explanatory comments.
\ You can edit this file in any spreadsheet app or text editor.

column2: be sure to select the pipe character (|) as the column separator.

column1: \ Be sure to set VS Code's Language Mode to "CSV (pipe)".
\ For editing in VS Code or other text editors
column2: you might want to make a hotkey to set up a new column instantly.

column1: \ This way you won't have to type out all the column dividers and today's date.
